How I Got Here

My Web Development Journey

I first learned about Web Development on January of 2017 when my mother told me that there is this online program that teaches various skills for undergrads, and there's this one course that would suite me well given my physical condition, and my computer savviness. At this point I have no idea how to code, I remember first time looking at a simple input element, and being confused as to what is the meaning of what.

The course itself was written, it was very basic it just basically introduces you to HTML5 and CSS3, and how they work. Now even though that course taught me so little it definitly gave me something I could call a skill that can get me somewhere, so I continued to scour the internet for more resources to learn from. It took me a year, and a half to have a great understanding of programming logic, and even then I still have a lot to learn.

When I got enough confidence in my skills I tried applying for jobs on various websites only to either get ignored, or not qualify at this point I'm so stressed out, but I kept at it. After another year of just endless studying, and finding ways to earn a job my folks started telling me to try getting into other stuff, because web development maybe just isn't for me I kept turning them down, because I'm tired of learning a certain set of skills just to maybe qualify for a job. At some point because of getting so stressed I decided give learning, and finding a job a rest for a few months, but keep finding ways to earn even a little amount of money using my skills.
